fiche_compostage-concerne_aussi:
Composting is the decomposition process. In first phase, the temperature can reach up to 70 °, and good ventilation is required (for the bacteria 'aerobic'). In second phase, fungi, earthworms and other small animals are at work It takes 6 months-1 year for good compost

Compost can contain .
- the kitchen scraps cereals, vegetable peelings, fruit, vegetables, coffee grounds, tea bags,
- the remains of the garden: faded flowers, leaves, hay, dried grass, weeds, straw , garden plants, sawdust sparingly,
- the remains of the house: ash (in small quantities), hair, paper towels, coffee filters, paper towels, paper, dust

Preferably avoid :
- the bread in large quantities, < BR /> - egg shells (non-biodegradable)
. - untreated citrus peel

Please do not put
- branches in large quantities,
- hazelnut and walnut shells,
- treated citrus peel,
- walnut leaves or rhubarb,
- cheese (attracts rats, mouse ...),
- fats,
- processed herbs,
- milk and dairy products,
- pet beds,
- diseased plants,
- rest of gardening in bulk size,
- meats (strong smell attracts rats, dogs ...)

Tips :
- balance between dry and wet waste
- airing: do not pack, but return occasionally,
- a little wet

Main source: Article Compost on Ekopedia
fiche_compostri-concerne_aussi:
Nantes This is a combination that helps the construction of collective composters, accompanying individuals to the creation and supply of compost. Compostri promotes the establishment of shared composting projects and accompanies the people in this process at the neighborhood level, building, group of buildings, kindergartens and schools ... in the territory of Nantes Métropole and with the support of this community. Today
120 shared composting sites are operating on the territory Nantes. These pavilions are set up with the support of Nantes Métropole
Compostri and three composters guides accompany project promoters citizens. Installation help composting pavilions, training, technical monitoring
<. br /> This association also accompanied school groups. associative restaurants, hostels for young, retirement homes and lately an average size (30 tonnes of bio-waste / year)
Address: 18, President of the dock Wilson, 44200 Nantes
Tel: 09 82 45 22 21
email: contact@compostri.fr
http://www.compostri.fr/
fiche_contembjournmag-concerne_aussi: can be put in the container magazines newspapers packaging: tin, aluminum trays, cans, aerosol metal syrup bottle, water bottles, bottle, brick (fruit, milk juice), cardboards, paper, newspapers, magazines
fiche_contvet-concerne_aussi:
Companies retrieve clothes for resale . In 2013 ten Company (no association) have 28,000 containers in France and recover about 200 000 tonnes of clothes. On one side tonne of used textiles rose from € 80 per tonne in 2007 to € 400 in 2013. On the other textile eco-contribution, established in 2008 (received € 0.005 for each garment sold) is paid to European companies that processes the recycled textiles (56 per tonne) at € 13 million overall) .
This system has flaws. The textile eco-contribution is paid without serious control takes place ( sorting is not always realized ) and this produces many transportation . Clothes are not distributed to those in need but resold (stickers on the containers associations - such as Emmaus' - means that the company that manages the container pays money to an association ).
Le Relais is a SCOP (workers' production cooperative), created in 1984, a number (55%) of the collection in France. The goal was to bring people into employment that Emmaus had welcomed. It therefore made social reintegration (currently 2,500 employees worldwide, including 2,000 in France) with annual Business in 2013 of 180 million euros. She containers 19000, 600 trucks and treats 100,000 tons of used clothing
The clothes are not redistributed. Designer clothes are sold in boutiques Le Relais, others are exported (especially to Africa where most is sold, some end up in dumps) and those used (30%) were processed by isolating and sold to the industry.

See 'loose sales' on the page 'Lieux'.

Arbalange
In 2009, they created Arbalange Nantais. This fueled SARL nurseries in cloth diapers. . It expanded (manufacture / sale of layers), but closed in 2011. Back on this experience

déchèteries and ecopoints are reserved for individuals living in the Nantes Urban Community .
Ecopoints are mini recycling centers where only rubble are not allowed. There are 4 on Nantes
    The following shall be permitted:.
  • rubble, rubble, bulky
  • electrical appliances
  • toxic waste ( in small amounts in ecopoints): paint, varnish, glue, thinners, batteries, motor oil ...
  • green waste

  • paper, cardboard, cardboards

fiche_ecoparticipation-concerne_aussi:
When buying a new appliance, you pay an eco-contribution', which is the cost of collection, reuse, decontamination and recycling an old appliance equivalent. The amount varies depending on the product and type of treatment he requires.

Eco-share is stated on labels and visibly separated from the product price. It is a tool of transparency and information. It is fully paid to an environmental organization Eco-systems as approved by the government to support older devices.
fiche_poubelle-concerne_aussi:
In 1883, the fight against dirt streets of Paris, the prefect Eugène Trash sign an order:
  • Owners must provide a container (common to all tenants) for household waste
  • 3 sorting boxes are required by tenant putrescible waste, paper / rags, glass / china / oyster shells
  • the regular collection of these containers is organized. The hostility owners (cost), janitors (extra work), ragpickers (loss of livelihoods) made little -to little old boxes were not replaced, and in the end we stopped sorting waste.
    Mr. Bin gave his name to the container, but we must recognize in him a precursor sorting even if it was not followed because of certain corporatism

    Main. Source: article on Wikipedia (the image from this site)
fiche_logos-concerne_aussi:
The manufacturer is contributing to one of these three companies: Eco-Emballage, Adelphe or Cyclamed. This does not mean that the product is recyclable .
There is a sorting instruction..
This product or the packaging is recycled .
This product and the packaging contains 65% recycled materials .


logos on plastic (non-exhaustive list of products):
  • 1: PET (Polyethylene terephthalate) bottles of soda recycled
  • 2: HDPE (high density polyethylene) bottle of milk, fruit, bleach juice, detergent, shampoo, recycled
  • 3: PVC (polyvinyl chloride) : detergent bottles, shampoo, gray pipe, electrical conduit ... recycled (rarely recycled)
  • 4: LDPE (Low Density Polyethylene): squeeze bottles, shopping bags, carpet: not recyclable (or difficult)
  • 5: PP (Polypropylene): yogurt cups, ketchup bottles, soft drink caps ... not recyclable (or difficult, as the plugs Love)
  • 6: EPS (Expanded Polystyrene): disposable plates, housings CDs, food tray not recyclable (or difficult)
  • 7: other plastics not recyclable (or difficult)
    • Favour products with the logos 1 and 2
    More. Info: http://www.lemballageecologique.com/actualites/symboles-logos-recyclage-emballages-plastiques/
fiche_lombricompost-concerne_aussi:
The lombricopost (or vermicompost) can convert biodegradable waste into natural fertilizer. Are used to rapidly degrade waste

No fermentation, so almost no odor
Unlike conventional compost there is no fermentation. There remains a slight smell of humus.

The compost worms
These worms (one of 150 earthworm species) can eat between half and 2 times their weight per day. They reproduce rapidly (the population can double every three months). They are sold on the Internet, in fishing the supermarket shelf. They can be found also in the pile of manure. They live in an environment between 15 and 25 degrees

The composter
The most common model is called horizontal. It includes 2 adjacent bins allowing rotation ( when the first is full, it then uses the second). If composters can be easily manufactured, you can buy them: be between 35 and 180 euros vermicomposter

A place
Rest of fruits and vegetables, paper. , cardboard, egg shells, nuts / nut shells, tree leaves, coffee grounds, tea bags, vacuum cleaner dust

Avoid
citrus, leeks, onions, shallots, pasta, rice, bread, hair, nails.

Do not
rhubarb, garlic, used tissues, meat , fish, litter, animal manure, dairy, fat and oil.

Warning moisture
To avoid the presence of flies, we must reduce the moisture compost, putting paper, cardboard, newspaper, coffee grounds ...

Main source: http://fr.ekopedia.org/Lombricompostage .

fiche_acier-concerne_aussi:
Steel disappears in 5-10 years.
abandoned in the open air, a steel box would put 5 to 10 years to disappear.
The French steel comes to 47% recycling
47% of the French steel industry is the 'scrap', which only uses scrap as secondary raw materials. The scrap is mainly comprised of household packaging sorted by the inhabitant.
fiche_recyclage_entreprse-concerne_aussi: The association Nantes TREES has two objectives: to recover certain waste (Surtour paper and cardboard, but also ink cartridges and electronic equipment) and support RMI recipients who work for the association. It has containers in businesses, and handles completely. More information http://arbres44.org .
fiche_pet-concerne_aussi:
The sorting center, the various plastics are separated into 3 categories:. HDPE (opaque) - Clear PET - PET dark
They are then baled for shipment to the regeneration plants

  • The bottles and PET bottles (plastic generally transparent) are mainly into fibers (polyester) for the quilt upholstery, automotive, insulation of flat roof .
  • The PET packaging may give bottles or other containers, provided you follow the laws or practice in force in each country for food contact.
  • The bottles and HDPE bottles (plastic generally opaque) become tubing, casing bins for pools, containers, street furniture or washing bottles.
fiche_tetrapak-concerne_aussi:
The Tetra Pak consist of three materials: cardboard about 75%, about 20% polyethylene, 5% aluminum. These components are separated very well.

In France papermakers 4 (2 in France, 1 in Spain and 1 in Germany) recover the sorted packaging Tetra Pak, and then separate the materials into pulpers.

  • the cardboard part is totally recycled,
  • plastic-aluminum can be transformed into a kind of plastic, but that's rarely the case.

    • So it is a recyclable product (although in reality only the cardboard is completely), but this recovery process is quite polluting. The glass is much less.
fiche_verre-concerne_aussi:
One that recycles glass bottles and packaging glass (bottles ...), which can be recycled endlessly. Other types of glass and dishware / china are not recyclable
Culinary glass and glass tableware have a different chemical composition of glass packaging makes possible their integration into cullet used in glass furnaces.
As for porcelain, earthenware and ceramic, are infusible materials that make it unusable cullet. They form inclusions that come undermine the bottle.

The collected glass must undergo a first manual sorting and several automatic sorting for the remove impurities. The collection of glass of different colors is ground into 'cullet'. This cullet permits the manufacture of new color bottles. If 'surtrié' (color sorting in a specialized center), it will even give colorless bottles.
fiche_velo-concerne_aussi:
There are four associations specialized in bicycle recovery in Nantes:

- Square bicycles : Brico -vélo events are held every first and third Saturday of each month from 14h to 18h, at 8 rue Auvours. Workshops are led by volunteers and one employee of Place au Vélo

-. Velocampus is an association that conducts participatory workshops and solidarity that aim to provide participants with some autonomy for the maintenance and repair their bikes. It's called the vélonomie! They allow many exchanges and practical to acquire, apply and also transmit know-how in this domaine.Nous recover all bikes in all states, to offer them a second life.

- Transformers (located in Nantes, Bellevue neighborhood). The bikes are disassembled and repaired with members. Thursday from 17h to 20h, and a two amedi (7 June, 21 June and 19 July 5 July).
- ATAO (located in Nantes and Saint-Herblain). ATAO is a rehabilitation association. On the bike business, for companies and individuals: - sale of bicycles repaired and guarantees - bicycle rental to allow to organize group outings - Maintenance of specific bicycle or a park '.
business
exist reuse associations that collect bicycles in addition to other waste:' The Ressourcerie of the island ...
Sources : sent by the associations on the form mieuxtrieranantes.fr 04/06/2014.

stco_reemploi_solilab-descr:
Two local players re-use and recovery unite in a new shop to offer a wide range of second-hand items: Le Comptoir.
  • Atelier du Retz Employment, runs a vocational track recovery and processing of objects for reuse. This is a Ressourcerie
    collecting, values, sorts, cleans and sells at low prices in its charity shopping recreating social links and providing a warm welcome.
  • The Atlantic Relais is an insertion company SCOP that collects, sorts and values ​​the textiles, footwear and linens. < br /> The clothing and items in good condition are sold at low prices in its network of second-hand shops 'DING FRING' and desk Solilab
    OPENING HOURS.: From Tuesday to Saturday from 10 am to 18 pm on déchèterie
    Permanences (déchèterie Tougas of Saint-Herblain and Recycling center of San Sebastian) you can deposit each day reusable objects
    Access: Tan: Off Line C5 'Quai des Antilles'
stco_reemploi_naga-descr: The Nâga is an association making recovery and computer donation Nantes Métropole. We operate in the IT asset recovery companies and private computers. The computers are then reconditioned and given to members of the association.

stco_reemploi_techrecyclage-descr:
Tech-Recycling recycles your broken or obsolete computer equipment. We also repair your laptops (broken screens, plastics ...). Removal
free on telephone request or email.
stco_reemploi_catourneautroc-descr: Consignment clothing and accessories. Woman and child. Deposit by appointment only.
stco_reemploi_boiteutile1-descr:
Driven by local associations monECOCITY Nantes and La Nizanerie, the collective Useful Boxes aims to promote, assist and unite the different projects 'GiveBox' on the chipboard.
Dedicated donation and exchange, these boxes come in the form of a wardrobe, a cabin or a large format cabin. They invite the residents of a neighborhood to file and / or find all sorts of items in good condition. Neither trash or mini recycling center, the useful citizen Box is a local solution to avoid waste and promote more sustainable consumption. It also creates a meeting place and conviviality.

stco_reemploi_react-descr:
RE-act is a born commissioned in 2010 offering local people to transform their clothes in order to offer a new unique and customized.
It mainly caters to low-consumerist looking for originality and uniqueness through a new experience of the garment and thus offers an attractive alternative to the use of new textiles.
Customers bring their old clothes shop, choose from the available sections and control their new clothing, personalized, made from their own clothes

stco_reemploi_baramel-descr: Recovery of bread. This insertion structure (controlled by the association Journey) is working 32 people. She stocks among 200 businesses that provide unsold. The transformed bread is then sold to be incorporated into the feed.
stco_reemploi_ressourcerieile-descr:
(Former name: Ecorev)
Reuse of objects of everyday life collection and recycling center at home on Nantes Métropole, and voluntary contributions to Rezé then resell cheap (furniture, dishes, toys, books, clothing, leisure items, tools ...)
What objects can we give / buy? Furniture, toy, baby, crockery, trinket, frame, book, clothing, linens, tools, gardening, cycling, lighting, CD-DVD, video games, bedding, sports equipment .... These everyday items must be in working order, clean, even if they have wear damage.
Since January 2015 it is possible to deposit small household appliances (which will be sold in stores) or large appliances (which will be sent to Envie44)
deposit of objects: Monday-Saturday from 9:30 am to 17h (there are more cuts noon)
Boutique solidarity: Wednesdays and Saturdays from 9:30 to 17:30 (excluding holidays)
Util'o'Bus: 2nd Wednesday of the month Dervallières (9h-12h), 3rd Wednesday of the month at La Bottière (14h-17h)
stco_reemploi_emmaus-descr: Furniture, appliances and utensils, bedding, blankets, towels, chandeliers and lamps, clothes, books, crockery ...
stco_reemploi_lhommedebout-descr:
Recovery furniture
insertion site carrying the furniture reconditioning
furniture is collected from individuals who wish to donate to the association. These are then restore or transform at the site and redistribute for free to people who do not have the financial means to buy the furniture. Furniture applications are in this case written request via social services.
stco_reemploi_relaisatlantique-descr:
Processing center clothing deposited in the Le Relais terminals. Reclamation of clothes, shoes, linen
Atlantic relay moved in October 2014. In 2014, this SCOP 17 employees-members (50% profits to members, 50% investment) manages 300 tonnes of clothing a month, has 14 trucks and vans.
See clothing containers

Collecting used paper. The association aims to finance educational humanitarian actions from an environmental gesture, sorting the paper.
In 2010, the paper activity of Hope (70 kms around Nantes) of participate and assist in the education of 7,000 children.
stco_reemploi_trisactifsouest-descr:
Created by the association Western Asset, the insertion company is specialized in
- Renovation reformed microcomputers and resale with warranty,
- dismantling provided by the insertion workshop for material 'obsolete' or down.
It is a repository of electrical and electronic equipment waste (D3E).
Tri Active West is labeled Ordi2.0 (national chain collection, renovation is reuse of computers).
It is also a place of sale of fixed or portable computers (with warranty), troubleshooting and parts sales.

Set Design Architecture Built Experimental Places. Our work is used in the creation of urban installation and temporary constructions recovered object-based .

stco_reemploi_envie44-descr:
Recovery and sale of appliances
Created by members of Emmaus, want now comprises 50 companies, including 2 in Loire Atlantique (Saint-Nazaire and St. Herblain), which represents 90 employees in the department.
It is a repository of electrical and electronic equipment waste (D3E). Individuals can drop
in waste collection centers or directly at Envie
44. It is also a store that has appliances at affordable prices.

collect, repair and distribute to the poor, particularly in the southern developing hardware, medical, paramedical and orthopedic collected in clinics, hospitals, center for elderly and disabled as well as individuals

stco_reemploi_frat-descr:
The Little Brothers escort individuals - primarily over fifty years. - With isolation, poverty, sickness, exclusions
I lay my clothes that I put more and where I bought some for one, two or five euros (5 euros is for sets) ... In front of the crumples, there is the flea market where we buy books, glasses, old stained bags back, wonderful vases for a round ... not any logic in relation to the world outside the frat. The book is worth 50 euros Cts whether of 1700 or 1999.

stco_reemploi_action44_reze-descr:
The association Actions
44 Cancer realize several actions that enable it to give money against cancer. In particular they recover corks. Several individuals recover in their homes these plugs (and usually they will seek in nearby restaurants) .On the Nantes region there is a person in Rezé and one in La Chapelle Sur Erdre.
caps must be placed in plastic bags outside their homes. They are then grouped together and sent to the association's headquarters in La Baule. They are recycled by a specialized company and the sum recovered is sent for anti-cancer Center Hospital Gauducheau (10 000 in 2010).
